VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.synopsis: Lae'zel remarks on the tieflgins' frailty, and the party responds.

VB_FishOutofWater.synopsis: Lae'zel remarks on the tieflgins' frailty, and the party responds.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Both the 'VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll' and 'VB_FishOutofWater' sessions share an identical synopsis indicating a scene involving Lae'zel and the party, but their names suggest they occur under differing conditions – one with Wyll present, and one without. This implies that they are mutually exclusive sequences since the scene cannot logically be triggered in two different character contexts simultaneously. There is no explicit ordering dependency between them as they represent alternative versions of the same event rather than sequential events.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll_0.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll_0.text: These tieflings prove fragile. I've a mind to end their misery myself.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll_1.speaker: Wyll
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll_1.text: Harsh. Remind me to stay on your good side.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll_2.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll_2.text: You were never on my good side.

VB_FishOutofWater_2.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater_2.text: These tieflings prove fragile. I've a mind to end their misery myself.

VB_FishOutofWater_1.speaker: Player
VB_FishOutofWater_1.text: Calm yourself. They're survivors, not soldiers.

VB_FishOutofWater_0.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater_0.text: I fail to see the distinction.
